oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Product quality as a function of light and nitrogene supply: contribute to a quality concept for organic agriculture?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Athmann, Miriam
Fritz, Jürgen
Köpke, Ulrich
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: For spring wheat and rocket lettuce, the influence of light intensity, N supply and fertilizer type on product quality was investigated. The quality assessment, based on morphological parameters, chemical compounds related to growth and differentiation, and image forming methods, is considered as an appropriate approach for Organic Agriculture.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Athmann, Miriam; Fritz, Jürgen and Köpke, Ulrich (2011) Product quality as a function of light and nitrogene supply: contribute to a quality concept for organic agriculture? In: Pulkrabova, Jana; Tomaniova, Monika; Kahl, Johannes and Hajšlová, Jana (Eds.) Book of Abstracts. International Conference of Food Quality and Health Research, ICT Prague Press, Prague, Czech Republic, p. 139.
